conclusion: To find the maximum distance between Car A and Car B, analyze their velocity-time graphs.
At t = 30 seconds, the cars are side by side.
Identify the other instance when they are side by side to determine maximum separation.
The area under the velocity-time graph represents the displacement.
For Car A, the velocity is constant at 40 m/s from t = 10 to t = 30 seconds.
From t = 10 to t = 30 seconds, Car A travels at 40 m/s, displacement = 800 m.
At t = 30 seconds, Car B reaches the same point as Car A.
The slope of Car B's velocity is 4/3 m/s².
Calculate area for Car B from t = 0 to t = 30, area = 600 m.
The maximum separation occurs when the difference in displacement is greatest.
At t = 20 seconds, Car A travels 400 m, Car B's displacement is 400 m.
Calculate the maximum distance: Car A = 400 m, Car B = 200 m, Maximum distance = 200 m.
The maximum distance between Car A and Car B is 100 meters.
